fi.shoppingList.resources

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.shoppingList.resources.Database

  • @Path(value="/items")
public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    REST middleware part of the Shopping List application. Every call to this class will either fetch data from database and returns it to the application, or gets data from application to add/update/delete data on database.
    Since:
    1.7
    Version:
    2016-11-25
    Author:
    Akash Singh

      • connection

        Establishes a connection to the database.

      • getItem

        @GET
 @Produces(value="application/xml")
 @Path(value="")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getItem()
        Fetches all data from database and passes it to application.
        Returns:
        response holds information about called request

      • addItem

        @PUT
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/xml")
 @Path(value="/add")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addItem(Item item)
        Adds an item to the database or updates an item in database. Goes through every item in database, if an item already exists with the same name, update it. If there is no match add a new item to the database.
        Parameters:
        item - item to add to database or update in database
        Returns:
        response holds information about called request

      • deleteItem

        @PUT
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/xml")
 @Path(value="/delete")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteItem(Item item)
        Deletes an item from database that is given in parameter. Normally we would use @DELETE instead of @PUT, but invocationBuilder cannot send data when sending delete calls. Making it harder to identify what we want to delete.
        Parameters:
        item - item to delete
        Returns:
        response holds information about called request

      • editItem

        @PUT
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/xml")
 @Path(value="/edit")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response editItem(Item item)
        Directly modifies given item in database.
        Parameters:
        item - item to modify
        Returns:
        response holds information about called request

      • addItems

        @PUT
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/xml")
 @Path(value="/array")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addItems(Items items)
        Pushes multiple items to the database.
        Parameters:
        items - items to push to database
        Returns:
        response holds information about called request
